chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andres J Garza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW Surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

2:08 PM  Attorney Payal Khandhar in court for Andres J Garza, who is appearing in court.  Attorney Lexie Keyes in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 3.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count 1,2 .

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT 3  
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years

-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Restitution: Hearing to be set
-Community Service: 7.5 hours
-Any other conditions DOC may impose
-Early termination at 18 months if completes obligations and agent approval.

-DNA surcharge waived

- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation

-Days credit if revoked: 4 days
